required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Evaluating Efficacy and Safety of VX-548 for Acute Pain After a Bunionectomy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Dose-ranging, Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of VX-548 for Acute Pain After a Bunionectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of VX-548 doses in treating acute pain after a bunionectomy.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Time-weighted sum of Pain Intensity Difference (SPID) as Recorded on a Numeric Pain Rating Scale (NPRS) 0 to 48 Hours (SPID48) After the First Dose of Study Drug
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0 to 48 Hours After the First Dose of Study Drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Time-weighted SPID as Recorded on a NPRS 0 to 24 Hours (SPID24) After the First Dose of Study Drug
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 to 24 Hours After the First Dose of Study Drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportions of Participants With >=30 Percent (%), >=50%, and >=70% Reduction in NPRS at 48 Hours After the First Dose of Study Drug
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 48 Hours After the First Dose of Study Drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of VX-548
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose to 12 Hours and 24 to 36 Hours After the First Dose of Study Drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of VX-548
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose to 12 Hours and 24 to 36 Hours After the First Dose of Study Drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve During a Dosing Interval (AUCtau) of VX-548
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose to 12 Hours and 24 to 36 Hours After the First Dose of Study Drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability as Assessed by Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)

arm_group.description: Participants will be randomized to receive different dose levels of VX-548.
Participants will receive placebos matched to VX-548 and HB/APAP.

intervention.description: Placebo matched to VX-548 for oral administration.
Placebo matched to HB/APAP for oral administration.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Before Surgery:
- Participant scheduled to undergo a primary unilateral bunionectomy with distal first metatarsal osteotomy (i.e., Austin procedure) and internal fixation under regional anesthesia (Mayo and popliteal sciatic block)
- After Surgery:
- Participant is lucid and able to follow commands
- All analgesic guidelines were followed during and after the bunionectomy
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Before Surgery:
- Prior history of bunionectomy or other foot surgery on the index foot
- History of cardiac dysrhythmias requiring anti-arrhythmia treatment(s)
- Any prior surgery within 1 month before the first study drug
- After Surgery:
- Participant had a Type 3 deformity requiring a base wedge osteotomy or concomitant surgery such as hammertoe repair, or had medical complications during the bunionectomy that, in the opinion of the investigator, should preclude randomization
Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

patient_data.ipd_description: Details on Vertex data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.vrtx.com/independent-research/clinical-trial-data-sharing
